item.title: Looking for experienced, friendly Developers! [562 or 317 Server]
item.dc:creator: @Premonition Premonition
item.description:
@Premonition wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:7, topic:481386”]Haha, you’re funny… First of all, no one can know everything. And with the age, Arham, who is 12 I believe, is way more experienced in Java than majority of everyone in this community, excluding a few people. I’m fairly experienced in Java and again, I can act immature because being serious all the time isn’t always great. If you’re trying to find someone who doesn’t troll, you came to the wrong community then.

Edit: Oh, good luck making a server that is as popular as RuneScape in a couple of months, if you even stick with this project that long.[/quote]

The really funny is you can’t understand what I writed above. Possibly a 12 years old have more experience, but I looking for normal peoples, who know many about the server creating. NO KIDS, TROLLS, RETARDS, are you understand me? I don’t really care how old are my partners, but to be sure, I need half-overgrown or overgrown persons. There is no chance to fail. And yes, you’re right. The Mopar, Rune Locus, and maybe the Rune-Server too, include a lot trolls… Well, goodbye then, good luck with trolling and destroy your life in this forum. If you think you’re the best cause you always trolling, then you already failed.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for experienced, friendly Developers! [562 or 317 Server]

item.title: Looking for experienced, friendly Developers! [562 or 317 Server]
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

[quote=“Premonition, post:3, topic:481386”][quote author=luna-scape link=topic=599624.msg4214098#msg4214098 date=1359991942]

  • Age over 17 year. If you under 17 year, you might be an un-serious person
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    Bull shit, age have nothing to do with that, look at Arnham?
    [/quote]

And say that who act like a 8 years old. That was what I mentioned above. Goodbye![/quote]
I am 8 years lol

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for experienced, friendly Developers! [562 or 317 Server]
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Haha, you’re funny… First of all, no one can know everything. And with the age, Arham, who is 12 I believe, is way more experienced in Java than majority of everyone in this community, excluding a few people. I’m fairly experienced in Java and again, I can act immature because being serious all the time isn’t always great. If you’re trying to find someone who doesn’t troll, you came to the wrong community then.

Edit: Oh, good luck making a server that is as popular as RuneScape in a couple of months, if you even stick with this project that long.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for experienced, friendly Developers! [562 or 317 Server]

item.title: Looking for experienced, friendly Developers! [562 or 317 Server]
item.dc:creator: @Premonition Premonition
item.description:
@Premonition wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

I’m 18 and I can act like a 10 year old. Age doesn’t really matter in this case. If you’re actually a good programmer in Java, you will know what’s wrong and what’s okay to do.

If you fully read the description, I looking for (if it’s possible) overgrown or REALLY normal persons, not trolls, kids, retards etc. Show me a kid who can act like a friendly person, and know everything… That’s why I looking for 17 year+ persons, they’re mostly trusted.

Quote Intelligent, non-trolling persons

Tell that last part to Jagex. They troll all of the time and yet, they still have thousands of players on daily.

I don’t care the Jagex. I will create a better RuneScape than the Jagex, because my goal is not getting money, and I will look for what the players need. They ruined one game, and that was enough, time to make everything good, and I know the way to succeed with that… My goal is give the players the best game, also release some other (new) features, which will be a new style of pk/pvp.

Read full topic
